thread.title: CCTV captured moment murderer Shaun Walmsley sprung from custody | Granada
thread.title_full: CCTV captured moment murderer Shaun Walmsley sprung from custody | Granada - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: CCTV captured moment murderer Shaun Walmsley sprung from custody | Granada
text:
CCTV images captured the moment convicted murderer Shaun Walmsley escaped custody as armed men freed him from prison guards.
CCTV captured the moment Walmsley was sprung for custody Credit: Merseyside Police Walmsley was sprung from custody during a visit to Aintree Hospital on Tuesday.
The CCTV shows the offenders with the security guards and Walmsley, but also shows a number of witnesses in the area who police think may well have been unaware of what was going on at the time.
The gold Volvo recovered by police can be seen blocking a car in Credit: Merseyside Police Detective Superintendent Natalie Perischine said:
The CCTV shows that the people involved in the actual incident were in a very close huddle and we know that the although a gun and knife were used by the offenders, they were not blatantly on show to other people walking by.
One pedestrian is wearing a particularly distinctive tartan/checked jacket. These witnesses may not have realised what was going on. They may have thought it looked a bit odd, but probably wouldn’t have thought anything of it.
– Detective Superintendent Natalie Perischine Shaun Walmsley is dangerous and police say he shouldn't be approached Credit: Merseyside Police Walmsey had been servicing a 30-year sentence for the murder of Anthony Duffy in May 2014.
Detective Superintendent Natalie Perischine explained:
I would like to reiterate that Shaun Walmsley, and the two others involved in the incident, are dangerous individuals and we will be relentless in our pursuit them.
We have put significant resources into this investigation and officers are working round the clock with other forces, the National Crime Agency and other police forces and agencies on the continent, and further afield, in a bid to trace him.
– Detective Superintendent Natalie Perischine Police say Walmsley is dangerous and shouldn't be approached, they're urging anyone who seems Walmsley to call them straightaway on 999. Anyone with information on his whereabouts can contact Merseyside Police or Crimestoppers.
Last updated Thu 23 Feb 2017 Read more 5 updates CCTV captures moment convicted murder escapes during hospital visit Liverpool Merseyside Police
